I know, I was explaining one of the differences in Linux.  Why you got the "command not found" when trying to run the ati file.  It wasn't in the PATH.  You can explicitly run it by specifying the exact full or relative path to the file.
i tried it in the downloads folder too
littlegirl   to run the file in the terminal, just prepend it (if you are in the same directory) with a "./" (without the quotation marks)
littlegirl and make sure it is "executable"  (chmod +x <filename>)
is the file "executable"?  do an "ls -l ati...," and see if the "x" bits are set.
it's a continuation of the line above.  If you didn't close a quotation mark, it's waiting for the rest of the line to be typed in.
littlegirl it won't run because it's not marked as being executable.  use the command:  chmod +x ati...
you need to learn about tab completion  :)
you can type in the first few letters and then <tab> and it will complete as much as it can of the command
littlegirl now just run it with: ./ati<tab>
